item.title: Gentoo On Vmware Fusion - unable to mount rootfs
item.description: I’ve been trying to install Gentoo linux as a guest on OSX using Vmware Fusion, After configuring the kernel, booting the system resulted: Using the Gentoo minimal bootable disc, we can identify what SCSI storage controller we have: lspci |grep -i scsi 00:10.0 SCSI storage controller: LSI Logic / Symbios Logic 53c1030 PCI-X Fusion-MPT Dual Ultra320 SCSI (rev 01) The Ultra 320 controller requires Fusion-MPT support in the kernel, that is located under:
